Title: Automate workflow based on Clickwrap agreement
SubTitle:
Demonstrates how to use the DocuSign Connect webhook service to automate business processes based on an example purchase license clickwrap. Once the user takes action on the clickwrap, the app will wait for a Connect notification before sending an example purchase confirmation to the user’s provided email.

Please provide your name and email address to get started.

ApiDecription.CodeFlow:
This sample features:

  • Create and activate a clickwrap
  • Embed a clickwrap on your site
  • DocuSign Connect webhook service
  • Remote signing

Code flow:

View source file clickwrap_service.rb on GitHub.

Step 1

Once recipient information is submitted by the user, the Click api is used to create a new clickwrap if it doesn’t already exist in the account. To create a clickwrap, we must provide a document for the user to read and agree to, a name for the clickwrap, and we must define display_settings which control what the UI experience will look like. The clickwrap is created using ClickWraps:createClickwrap. Then we must activate the clickwrap before use with ClickWraps:updateClickwrapVersion by updating the clickwrap version 1 and setting the status to active

.
Step 2

Using the id of the clickwrap created in the previous step, we display the clickwrap using a JavaScript API call to the docuSignClick.Clickwrap.render() method. Required arguments include clickwrap_environment which is ‘https://demo.docusign.net’ for the development environment, clickwrap_account_id which is the account id for the preconfigured DocuSign demo account, clickwrap_id which we obtain in the previous step, and client_user_id which is created in the app session. To make this client-side API call the code needs to include https://demo.docusign.net/clickapi/sdk/latest/docusign-click.js in the page as a script element.

Step 3

Once the user accepts or declines the clickwrap, we wait for a DocuSign Connect notification to tell us what action was taken. If we receive a click-agreed notification, we can start the next step of the example workflow, otherwise the workflow ends at this step. The screenshot below shows the events we subscribe to in our custom Connect configuration in the preconfigured account.

Step 4

View source code send_envelope_service.rb on GitHub.

After receiving the click-agreed notification, we use the DocuSign eSignature API to create an envelope with Envelopes:create. In the envelope definition we include a recipient with the information submitted by the user, a sample purchase confirmation document, and tabs. We set the envelope definition status to sent so that the envelope is sent immediately when we make our api call.
